alert.note: Alert for Amite; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 12:32PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Walthall, Pike and eastern Amite Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1232 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bogue Chitto to near Magnolia. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mccomb, Magnolia, Summit, Tylertown, Osyka, Salem, Dexter, Gillsburg and Mccomb Airport. This includes Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for southern Mississippi.
